title.narrative: Public-Private Partnership for restoration of degraded forest reserve through VCS and FSC certified plantations

description.narrative: The project aims at catalyzing private sector involvement in large-scale sustainable and commercial teak plantations in degraded forest reserves in Ghana by expanding an existing – and both Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) and Verified Carbon Standard certified (VCS) - forest plantation from a current size of 5,000ha (end 2014) to 11.700 ha of sustainable commercial forest plantation composed of 10% indigenous tree species and 90% teak. The estimated net greenhouse gas sequestration potential for the entire project (i.e. 11.700 ha) is around 2.8 million tCO2 over 40 years or 70,103 tCO2 per year. In addition, the project will create 400 direct fulltime jobs and 600 direct seasonal jobs.
